title: Ephesians Chapter 1 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ephesians chapter 1 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ephesians Chapter 1 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ephesians Chapter 1.

questions.question: Who is the apostle mentioned in Ephesians 1:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Paul
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:1 identifies Paul as the apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God.

questions.question: To whom is the letter in Ephesians 1 addressed according to verse 1?
questions.correctAnswer: Saints at Ephesus
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:1 states that the letter is to the saints which are at Ephesus and to the faithful in Christ Jesus.

questions.question: What does Paul wish for the recipients in Ephesians 1:2?
questions.correctAnswer: Grace and peace
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:2 says, 'Grace be to you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.'

questions.question: According to Ephesians 1:3, with what has God blessed us?
options: All spiritual blessings in heavenly places
questions.correctAnswer: All spiritual blessings in heavenly places
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:3 states that God has blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ.

questions.question: When did God choose us according to Ephesians 1:4?
options: Before the foundation of the world
At the time of Jesus' birth
questions.correctAnswer: Before the foundation of the world
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:4 mentions that God chose us in Him before the foundation of the world.

questions.question: What has God predestinated us unto, as mentioned in Ephesians 1:5?
options: Adoption of children by Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Adoption of children by Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:5 says God predestinated us unto the adoption of children by Jesus Christ to Himself.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 1:7, what do we have through Jesus Christ?
questions.correctAnswer: Redemption through His blood
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:7 explains that in Jesus we have redemption through His blood, the forgiveness of sins.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 1:9 say God has made known to us?
questions.correctAnswer: The mystery of His will
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:9 states God has made known to us the mystery of His will according to His good pleasure.

questions.question: Ephesians 1:10 speaks of gathering all things together in whom?
questions.correctAnswer: Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 10 describes the gathering together of all things in Christ at the dispensation of the fullness of times.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 1:13, what seals believers?
questions.correctAnswer: The Holy Spirit of promise
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:13 states that believers were sealed with the Holy Spirit of promise after believing the gospel.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 1:6 says God has made us accepted in the beloved to the praise of the glory of His grace.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:6 clearly states that God made us accepted in the beloved for the praise of the glory of His grace.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 1:20 describes God raising Jesus from the dead and seating Him at His right hand in heavenly places.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:20 confirms that God raised Christ from the dead and set Him at His own right hand in heavenly places.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 1:22 states that all things are under Jesus' feet and He is head over all things to the church.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:22 notes that God put all things under Jesus' feet and made Him head over all things to the church.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Ephesians 1:17: 'That the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give unto you the spirit of ______ and revelation in the knowledge of him:'
questions.correctAnswer: wisdom
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:17 says God may give you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 1:23, the church is described as what?
options: His body, the fullness of Him
questions.correctAnswer: His body, the fullness of Him
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:23 describes the church as His body, the fullness of Him that filleth all in all.

medium.title: Ephesians Chapter 1 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ephesians Chapter 1 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with feelings of worthlessness. Based on Ephesians 1, what biblical truth would you share to encourage their identity in Christ?
options: They are chosen and adopted as God's children before the foundation of the world
Their worth depends on their own achievements
They must earn their place through good works
questions.correctAnswer: They are chosen and adopted as God's children before the foundation of the world
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:4-5 teaches that God chose us before the foundation of the world and predestinated us to adoption through Jesus Christ, affirming our secure identity in Him.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 1 teach us about the role of prayer in spiritual growth?
options: We should constantly give thanks and ask God for wisdom and revelation
Prayer is only necessary in times of crisis
Prayer should be silent and private only
questions.correctAnswer: We should constantly give thanks and ask God for wisdom and revelation
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:16-17 emphasizes continual thanksgiving and asking God to grant the Spirit of wisdom and revelation to know Him better.

questions.question: A believer wants to understand their hope and inheritance in Christ. According to Ephesians 1, what should you tell them?
options: Their hope is the riches of God’s glory and an inheritance in the saints
Their hope depends on their future good deeds
Inheritance is only for the apostles
Hope is uncertain and based on luck
questions.correctAnswer: Their hope is the riches of God’s glory and an inheritance in the saints
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:18 explains that believers' understanding is enlightened to know the hope of God's calling and the riches of the glory of His inheritance in the saints.

questions.question: How does this passage teach us about forgiveness and reconciliation?
options: We have redemption and forgiveness of sins through the blood of Christ
Forgiveness must be earned by others
Forgiveness only applies to certain sins
questions.correctAnswer: We have redemption and forgiveness of sins through the blood of Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:7 states that in Christ we have redemption through His blood and forgiveness of sins according to the riches of His grace.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 1 teach about the power available to believers to persevere through trials?
options: God’s exceeding greatness of power is at work in believers, as demonstrated by raising Christ from the dead
Believers must rely solely on their own strength
Power is only for church leaders
Trials mean God has abandoned us
questions.correctAnswer: God’s exceeding greatness of power is at work in believers, as demonstrated by raising Christ from the dead
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:19-20 describes the surpassing power God works in believers, the same power that raised Christ from the dead and seated Him at His right hand.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with contentment in their role within the church. What biblical truth from Ephesians 1 can encourage them?
options: Christ is the head of the church, which is His body, and believers are part of that body
Only some believers are important in the church
The church is a human organization, not connected to Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Christ is the head of the church, which is His body, and believers are part of that body
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:22-23 teaches that Christ is the head over all things to the church, His body, which is the fullness of Him who fills all in all, affirming every believer's value.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ephesians 1, the Holy Spirit is the seal of believers after they trust in the gospel.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:13-14 states that after believing the gospel, believers are sealed with the Holy Spirit as a promise and guarantee of their inheritance.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 1 teach us about generosity and stewardship?
options: God has blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ
We should only focus on earthly wealth
Blessings are earned by giving money
Generosity is optional for spiritual growth
questions.correctAnswer: God has blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:3 reminds us that God has blessed believers richly with spiritual blessings, which encourages responsible stewardship of these gifts.

questions.question: How does this passage teach humility and gratitude in the Christian life?
options: We are accepted in the beloved through God’s grace, prompting praise of His glory
Our acceptance depends on our efforts
We should boast in our achievements
Gratitude is only necessary for material blessings
questions.correctAnswer: We are accepted in the beloved through God’s grace, prompting praise of His glory
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:6 explains that God made us accepted in the beloved to the praise of the glory of His grace, encouraging humble gratitude.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 1 teaches that all things in heaven and on earth will be gathered together in Christ at the fullness of times.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:10 states that God’s purpose is to gather all things in Christ at the dispensation of the fullness of times.

questions.question: A fellow believer is unsure about the certainty of their salvation. What biblical truth from Ephesians 1 can you share?
options: Believers are sealed with the Holy Spirit as a guarantee of their inheritance
Salvation depends on daily perfect conduct
Salvation is uncertain until the end of life
Only apostles receive the Holy Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: Believers are sealed with the Holy Spirit as a guarantee of their inheritance
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:13-14 explains that after trusting the gospel, believers are sealed with the Holy Spirit, the earnest of their inheritance until redemption.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 1 show the importance of faith and love in the Christian community?
options: Paul thanks God for the Ephesian believers' faith in the Lord and love for all the saints
Faith and love are private and do not affect the community
Only love matters, faith is optional
Faith is intellectual only, without need for love
questions.correctAnswer: Paul thanks God for the Ephesian believers' faith in the Lord and love for all the saints
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:15 shows Paul’s gratitude for their faith and love, emphasizing their vital role in Christian fellowship.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Ephesians 1, God works all things according to the counsel of His own ___.
questions.correctAnswer: will
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:11 teaches that God works all things according to the counsel of His own will, showing His sovereign plan.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 1 encourage believers to understand their spiritual blessings?
options: They are given all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ
Blessings are only earthly and material
Believers have no spiritual blessings yet
questions.correctAnswer: They are given all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:3 affirms that God has blessed believers with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly realms in Christ.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 1 guide believers in knowing God’s will?
options: God has made known the mystery of His will according to His good pleasure
God’s will is hidden and unknowable
questions.correctAnswer: God has made known the mystery of His will according to His good pleasure
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:9 reveals that God has made known the mystery of His will to believers, showing His purposes.

hard.title: Ephesians Chapter 1 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ephesians Chapter 1.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 1:4, when did God choose the believers to be holy and blameless in love?
options: Before the foundation of the world
questions.correctAnswer: Before the foundation of the world
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:4 explicitly states that God chose believers in Christ before the foundation of the world to be holy and blameless in love, highlighting the eternal plan of salvation.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'sealed with that holy Spirit of promise' in Ephesians 1:13?
options: It denotes the guarantee of the believer’s inheritance
It refers to the baptism of John the Baptist
It means a temporary blessing given only to apostles
It describes the anointing of kings in the Old Testament
questions.correctAnswer: It denotes the guarantee of the believer’s inheritance
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:13 describes believers being sealed with the Holy Spirit as an earnest or guarantee of their inheritance, securing their future redemption.

questions.question: In Ephesians 1:7, what theological concept is primarily conveyed by the phrase 'redemption through his blood'?
questions.correctAnswer: Atonement for sins
questions.explanation: The phrase 'redemption through his blood' in Ephesians 1:7 refers to Christ’s sacrificial death providing atonement, a key New Testament theme reflecting Old Testament sacrificial systems.

questions.question: Ephesians 1:11 describes believers as 'predestinated according to the purpose of him who worketh all things after the counsel of his own will.' This reflects which theological doctrine?
questions.correctAnswer: Divine sovereignty
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes God's sovereign control over all things, predestinating believers according to His purpose, which aligns with the doctrine of divine sovereignty.

questions.question: What is the literary function of the repeated phrase 'to the praise of his glory' found in Ephesians 1:6, 12, and 14?
options: It serves as a refrain emphasizing the ultimate purpose of salvation
It functions as a legalistic warning
questions.correctAnswer: It serves as a refrain emphasizing the ultimate purpose of salvation
questions.explanation: The repeated phrase acts as a refrain underscoring that all aspects of salvation are intended to glorify God, a literary device that unifies the chapter's message.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 1:10’s theme of 'gathering together in one all things in Christ' relate to Old Testament prophetic expectations?
options: It fulfills the prophecy of universal restoration in Isaiah
It echoes the covenant made with Abraham
It reiterates the Sinai law code
questions.correctAnswer: It fulfills the prophecy of universal restoration in Isaiah
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:10 alludes to the prophetic vision of universal reconciliation and restoration found in Isaiah, where God’s kingdom unites all creation under His reign.

questions.question: Which Greek term used in Ephesians 1:5 translated as 'predestinated' carries the meaning of 'marked out beforehand' or 'appointed in advance'?
questions.correctAnswer: προορίζω (proorizō)
questions.explanation: The Greek word προορίζω (proorizō) in Ephesians 1:5 means 'to determine beforehand' or 'predestinate,' indicating God's sovereign appointment of believers.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 1:20 states that God raised Christ from the dead and seated Him at His right hand in the heavenly places, indicating Christ’s exalted authority over all spiritual powers.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:20 affirms Christ’s resurrection and exaltation to the right hand of God, symbolizing supreme authority over all powers, a key theme in early Christian Christology.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 1:3, where has God blessed believers with all spiritual blessings?
questions.correctAnswer: In heavenly places in Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:3 states that God has blessed believers with all spiritual blessings in the heavenly realms, emphasizing the cosmic and spiritual scope of salvation.

questions.question: What is the role of the church described in Ephesians 1:22-23?
options: The church is the body of Christ, the fullness of Him who fills all in all
The church is a political kingdom on earth
The church is a temporary institution until the law is fulfilled
The church is a secret society
questions.correctAnswer: The church is the body of Christ, the fullness of Him who fills all in all
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:22-23 describes the church as Christ’s body and the fullness of Him, indicating the intimate union between Christ and His people.

questions.question: In the context of Ephesians 1:17-18, what does 'the eyes of your understanding being enlightened' metaphorically represent?
options: Spiritual insight and knowledge of God’s hope and inheritance
questions.correctAnswer: Spiritual insight and knowledge of God’s hope and inheritance
questions.explanation: Paul prays for spiritual illumination so believers may understand the hope and riches of their calling, using the metaphor of enlightened eyes for insight.

questions.question: Which Old Testament concept does the 'adoption of children' in Ephesians 1:5 most closely parallel?
options: The covenantal inclusion of Israel as God's chosen people
questions.correctAnswer: The covenantal inclusion of Israel as God's chosen people
questions.explanation: The concept of adoption reflects God's covenant relationship with Israel as His chosen family, now extended to believers through Christ as described in Ephesians 1:5.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 1:19-21 highlights the surpassing greatness of God's power demonstrated through Christ's resurrection and exaltation over all spiritual authorities.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: These verses emphasize the immense power God exercised when raising Christ and seating Him above all powers, underscoring Christ's supreme authority.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 1:8-9, what has God made known to believers?
options: The mystery of His will according to His good pleasure
The laws of the Medes and Persians
The agricultural festivals of the temple
questions.correctAnswer: The mystery of His will according to His good pleasure
questions.explanation: Paul states that God revealed the mystery of His will to believers, referring to the divine plan of salvation and unity in Christ.

questions.question: What is the significance of Paul addressing 'the saints which are at Ephesus, and to the faithful in Christ Jesus' in Ephesians 1:1?
options: It establishes the recipients as holy and committed believers, appropriate for receiving doctrinal teaching
It denotes a social club membership
questions.correctAnswer: It establishes the recipients as holy and committed believers, appropriate for receiving doctrinal teaching
questions.explanation: Paul’s greeting identifies the Ephesians as saints and faithful in Christ, setting the tone for theological instruction and encouragement.

theological.title: Ephesians Chapter 1 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ephesians Chapter 1 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 1, what was God's purpose in choosing believers before the foundation of the world?
options: That they should be holy and without blame before Him in love
That they should gain earthly wealth and power
That they would perform great miracles
That they would rule over nations
questions.correctAnswer: That they should be holy and without blame before Him in love
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:4 states God chose us to be holy and blameless in love, reflecting His sanctifying purpose. This aligns with 1 Peter 1:15-16 which calls believers to holiness, and Leviticus 11:44 emphasizing holiness because God is holy.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 1:7 say is the means through which we have redemption?
questions.correctAnswer: Through His blood
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:7 clearly states redemption comes through the blood of Christ, highlighting the substitutionary atonement. This is consistent with Hebrews 9:12 and 1 Peter 1:18-19 about redemption through Christ's blood.

questions.question: In Ephesians 1, what is described as the 'earnest of our inheritance'?
questions.correctAnswer: The Holy Spirit
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:14 identifies the Holy Spirit as the guarantee or earnest of our inheritance, ensuring future redemption. This is consistent with 2 Corinthians 1:22 and Romans 8:23 which speak of the Spirit as a seal and guarantee.

questions.question: What is Paul’s stated desire for the Ephesian believers in Ephesians 1:17?
options: That God would give them the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him
That they would gain material wealth
That they would become powerful rulers
questions.correctAnswer: That God would give them the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:17 expresses Paul's prayer for spiritual enlightenment and deeper knowledge of God, which aligns with Colossians 1:9 and James 1:5 emphasizing wisdom from God.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 1:11, how are believers predestinated?
options: According to the purpose of Him who works all things after the counsel of His own will
questions.correctAnswer: According to the purpose of Him who works all things after the counsel of His own will
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:11 teaches predestination is according to God's sovereign purpose and will, consistent with Romans 8:28-30 and Isaiah 46:10 which affirm God’s control over all events.

questions.question: What is the ultimate goal of God's grace as expressed in Ephesians 1:6?
options: To the praise of the glory of His grace
questions.correctAnswer: To the praise of the glory of His grace
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:6 shows that God’s grace is meant to glorify Him, which is echoed in Romans 11:36 and 1 Corinthians 10:31 where all things are for God's glory.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 1:10 describe as being gathered together in Christ?
options: All things in heaven and on earth
questions.correctAnswer: All things in heaven and on earth
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:10 states that God’s plan is to unite all things in Christ, which fits the biblical theme of cosmic reconciliation found in Colossians 1:20 and Philippians 2:10-11.

questions.question: Who is described as the 'head over all things to the church' in Ephesians 1?
questions.correctAnswer: Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:22 declares that Christ is exalted above all and given as head over the church, consistent with Colossians 1:18 and Hebrews 1:3 describing Christ's supremacy.

questions.question: Ephesians 1:13 mentions believers being sealed with what after believing the gospel?
questions.correctAnswer: The Holy Spirit of promise
questions.explanation: The sealing by the Holy Spirit is emphasized in Ephesians 1:13 as a guarantee of salvation, supported by 2 Corinthians 1:22 and John 14:16-17 where the Spirit is described as a seal and helper.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 1:3, where has God blessed believers with all spiritual blessings?
questions.correctAnswer: In heavenly places in Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:3 indicates spiritual blessings are given in heavenly realms in Christ, consistent with Colossians 3:1 and Romans 8:34 which speak of believers seated with Christ in heavenly places.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 1:18 say believers should know about?
options: The hope of His calling and the riches of the glory of His inheritance in the saints
The laws of the Roman Empire
questions.correctAnswer: The hope of His calling and the riches of the glory of His inheritance in the saints
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:18 urges believers to understand the hope and glory of their divine calling, in line with 1 Peter 1:3-4 and Romans 8:17 which speak of inheritance and hope.

questions.question: In Ephesians 1, what is the mystery of His will according to verse 9?
options: God's plan to unite all things in Christ
The timing of the Law's fulfillment
questions.correctAnswer: God's plan to unite all things in Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:9 reveals the mystery as God's purpose to unite all things in Christ, which is consistent with Colossians 1:26-27 and 1 Corinthians 2:7 about God’s hidden wisdom.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 1:15 express Paul's attitude towards the Ephesian believers?
options: He gives thanks for their faith and love
He is indifferent to their condition
questions.correctAnswer: He gives thanks for their faith and love
questions.explanation: Paul expresses gratitude for their faith and love in Ephesians 1:15, reflecting 1 Thessalonians 1:2 and Philippians 1:3 where Paul frequently thanks God for believers.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 1:20-21, where is Christ seated after His resurrection?
options: At God's right hand in the heavenly places, far above all principality and power
In a synagogue teaching the Law
On earth as a political ruler
questions.correctAnswer: At God's right hand in the heavenly places, far above all principality and power
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:20-21 describes Christ exalted to God's right hand far above all powers, consistent with Acts 2:33 and Hebrews 1:3 affirming Christ's supreme exaltation.

questions.question: What is the church described as in Ephesians 1:23?
options: His body, the fullness of Him who fills all in all
questions.correctAnswer: His body, the fullness of Him who fills all in all
questions.explanation: Ephesians 1:23 calls the church the body of Christ, emphasizing its organic union with Him, consistent with 1 Corinthians 12:27 and Colossians 1:18.
